newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: CAM says to sell property for S$29 mln.
newsitem.headline: CAM says to sell property for S$29 mln.

text.p: CAM International Holdings Ltd, the main board listed firm embroiled in fraud allegations, said on Thursday it was selling a Singapore industrial property for Singapore $29.0 million.
CAM said in a statement it expected to make a S$4.48 million net gain on the deal to dispose of the building in central Singapore for which the firm says it no longer has any use.

CAM paid S$22.8 million for the property in June 1996 with the aim of making it a corporate headquarters as well as housing research and development (R&D) and subsidiary manufacturing operations there.
Lower costs in Malaysia had caused the company to rethink the strategy and instead base R&D and manufacturing in Malaysia.
"As the original purpose of acquiring the property is no longer valid, the company has decided to sell the property", the statement said.
The deal has to be approved by the government's Housing Development Board and by CAM shareholders, unless the Stock Exchange of Singapore (SES) waives that requirement.
CAM said it had asked the SES to clarify the point.
Shares in CAM were suspended on April 30 after an auditor's report on the company was delivered to the Ministry of Finance.
The report, made public on Monday, alleges possible breaches of the companies act and penal code by certain CAM directors.
